scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
hor, dence, vant, sell, ra, con, ri, fy, ban, cu, soon, menopause, ser, fi, tors, ing, dits, ing

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — SYN: betray
B. (2 syllables) — SYN: handmaid
C. (3 syllables) — SYN: conservator
D. (3 syllables) — SYN: assurance
E. (1 syllables) — SYN: change of life
F. (1 syllables) — SYN: before long
G. (2 syllables) — SYN: bandit
H. (4 syllables) — SYN: alarm

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
step, wood, olympics, end, ing, ry, quar, leg, walls, apos, lawyers, lakes, ob, er, moth, struct, en, tolic

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — a body of (usually fresh) water surrounded by land
B. (3 syllables) — shut out from view or get in the way so as to hide from sight
C. (1 syllables) — a professional person authorized to practice law; conducts lawsuits or gives legal advice
D. (2 syllables) — A musical composition set to a poetical story.
E. (1 syllables) — Any real or perceived competition.
F. (2 syllables) — lacking ease or grace
G. (2 syllables) — To secure prey; to prey, as a vulture or harpy.
H. (2 syllables) — Pertaining to apostles or their practice or teaching; pertaining to the apostles (of early Christianity) or their teachings.
I. (3 syllables) — A viola, especially , heartsease.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ing, due, shat, docked, over, cast, re, de, branch, re, fen, make, ni, fledged, pired, def, vised, dants, ter, i, er, tions, flags, topes

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: re-) — To make a new, especially updated, version of (a film, video game, etc.).
B. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: re-, suffix: -ed) — revise or reorganize, especially for the purpose of updating and improving
C. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: de-) — a person or institution against whom an action is brought in a court of law; the person being sued or accused
D. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: over-) — Late; especially, past a deadline or too late to fulfill a need.
E. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -er) — Someone or something that casts.
F. (1 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ed) — decorate with feathers
G. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ing) — resembling the branches of a tree
H. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -er) — To violently break something into pieces.
I. (4 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: de-) — a concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
per, prc, lim, tam, jump, late, cir, thorn, ipad, it, i, cu, mit, less, sale, truths, nants, con, known, stroller

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — To allow, to admit (of).
B. (1 syllables) — Any shrub or small tree that bears thorns, especially a hawthorn.
C. (4 syllables) — a substance that contaminates
D. (1 syllables) — Men's semiformal daytime dress comprising a grey or black single- or double-breasted coat, grey striped or checked formal trousers, a grey or silver necktie, and a grey, black or buff waistcoat.
E. (1 syllables) — an occasion (usually brief) for buying at specially reduced prices

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
